question: On which date, the 2019 edition of World Sickle Cell Day (WSCD) is observed?
explanation: The World Sickle Cell Day (WSCD) is observed  every year on 19th of June to raise public awareness about the sickle cell disease and its treatment methods. Sickle cell disease is an inherited form of anaemia in which red blood cells are not able to carry adequate oxygen throughout the body. Government has organised several campaigns for the proper treatment and cure of those suffering from the disease.
